update list feature to show task status
add mark as done feature
Add mark as not done feature
add Todo class
add deadline class
add Event class
add support for adding Todo, Deadline, Event to tasklist
fixed bugs for echo and list feature and corrected formatting issues when displaying text
added semi-automated testing of chatbot
Added Exception class

Add exception handling for unknown user inputs and invalid inputs for todo, deadline and event
add invalid input handling to mark and unmark feature

Update error handling for mark, unmark and delete to cover wider range of errors

added separators to text for neatness
Add loadTasklist function on startup
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot has no ability to retain previously written tasks by
the user.

It would enhance the functionality of the chatbot to be able to
remember tasks so it needs to be able to load data.

Let's:
Use a text file to load Todo, Deadline, and Event items when the
chatbot starts, with the use of the java.nio.file library.
Ensure the chatbot creates a data folder and an empty text file
if they do not exist on startup.

If the chatbot is able to load data from a text file, we can alter
this text file to include user data.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add convertToDataFormat function to Task and its children
commitResults.messageBody:
We have no convenient way of producing the required data format for
a Task class and its children.

We need a function to streamline the process of getting the string
to be written to text file.

Let's include the function in Task and use polymorphism to create
the child's own convertToDataFormat function

Using polymorphism reduces the amount of checks needed for what
format should be used depending on the class.

There are common fields in the data between Task and its children
so polymorphism is suitable to be used.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add overwriteTasklist and appendToTasklist functions
commitResults.messageBody:
we have no functions to modify the data in the text file.

we need a way to save the user's changes to the tasklist to
complement the load tasklist functionality.

Lets,
*create a appendToTasklist function that append a new line of data
to the text file.
*create an overwriteTasklist function that loop through the tasklist
arraylist to overwrite the text file data by writing to it line by
line.

We use appendToTasklist when adding a new Task to the Text for
efficiency (since it directly adds to the list) while overwrite
is only used for modifying existing data (e.g. mark and delete).

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-level-7'
Add processLocalDateTime function
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot takes in dates as Strings and simply repeats them.

Chatbot usability would improve if it can handle a range of
datetime formats from user

Let's
* add processLocalDateTime function to parse a set of defined
datetime formats
* ensure processLocalDateTime can handle both date and datetime by
padding date with default time value

Doing this will allow the user more flexibility in the type of
date inputs given.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Deadline and Event class to handle LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Using String for dates makes error handling and formatting much
more difficult.

Let's update Deadline and Event to use LocalDateTime instead of
String for any dates and update the toString to use a more readable
date format.

Should allow users to at a glance tell what datetime it is.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated processLocalDateTime to no longer handle LocalDate
commitResults.messageBody:
processLocalDateTime was taking LocalDate and convert it to
LocalDateTime with a default value of 12am.

It should be removed since it can confuse the user with a value he
did not input.

commitResults.messageTitle: Reorder localDateTimePatterns
commitResults.messageBody:
The order made it so that the second format would never be checked.

Reduces the amount of formats a user can input.

Lets swap the order so that the second format is now checked first.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
